channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-3171] Drop ROOT and instead store META location(s) directly in ZooKeeper
item.description:
Rather than storing the ROOT region location in ZooKeeper, going to ROOT, and reading the META location, we should just store the META location directly in ZooKeeper.

The purpose of the root region from the bigtable paper was to support multiple meta regions. Currently, we explicitly only support a single meta region, so the translation from our current code of a single root location to a single meta location will be very simple. Long-term, it seems reasonable that we could store several meta region locations in ZK. There's been some discussion in HBASE-1755 about actually moving META into ZK, but I think this jira is a good step towards taking some of the complexity out of how we have to deal with catalog tables everywhere.

As-is, a new client already requires ZK to get the root location, so this would not change those requirements in any way.

The primary motivation for this is to simplify things like CatalogTracker. The way we can handle root in that class is really simple but the tracking of meta is difficulty and a bit hacky. This hack on tracking of the meta location is what caused one of the bugs over in HBASE-3159.
item.summary: Drop ROOT and instead store META location(s) directly in ZooKeeper

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
having fixed master META issues in the past, I am a big +1 on this, the dual level really creates a lot of complexity.

We wouldnt even have to get rid of multiple region META, we could just store the entire META region address info in 1 node, or N nodes in 1 directory, and let clients retrieve the whole thing and do the sorting/lookup locally. Multi-META was broken recently anyways, so this might fix it.

+1, in my mind, the ROOT table is very important of routing the right RegionServer of .META. The whole system could be out-of-service in case the Region of SequenceFile of the ROOT can NOT be opened. Thus, i quite agree that we put the .META. directly into Zookeeper to reduce this. We can avoid one case of failure.
Moving out of 0.92.0. Pull it back in if you think different.

I took a look at what is involved here. I first started out just hacking ROOT out of hbase completely. It was fun while it lasted (The root location in zk would instead become the meta location w/ a watcher, etc.). On my bike ride home I figured it'd be better if I could make it so old clients looking for a ROOT no longer there would still sort of work. I dug around but was unable to figure a way of making this work, not w/o leaving a ROOT placeholder in place and then adding interception code that would take a different route if we were "scanning" the now non-existent to find the meta location now up in zk rather than in a root table; in other words, adding more, cryptic code. It looked to get ugly fast too.

So, I see no way of doing this w/o breaking backward compatibility. Old code would go looking for a non-existent ROOT region. Do we want to do this?

Thanks for taking a look. Need to think about backward compatibility more. Might need to hold off until some future big client/server change?

Were you think that meta locations would be in both the META region(s) as well as up in ZK? Or just in ZK? If it was in both, then should be easier to provide backwards compatibility.

Which would be source of truth and which would be relied upon for persistence? I suppose all the data in meta is recoverable from the regions themselves (or should be) between restarts so we wouldn't have a hard requirement on zk persistence between restarts. Doing the meta edits in zk might help suss out some of those trickier race conditions around region movement, splitting, meta updating, and crashing.

Was also thinking we should revisit the idea of more intelligent redirecting of clients along with NSREs while looking at this stuff.

First pass on this based on latest trunk. Works on a cluster, haven't encountered any issue. Still need to:

  • Modify the unit tests
  • Fix the PB migration code
  • Write the migration for this jira
  • Finish fixing HBCK

This v2 has some code cleanup done, HBCK's test is passing, and I tested it on a cluster where I moved .META. and killed the RS that was then holding it while importing data.

Next up is trying to figure out what to do with MetaNodeTracker and metaAvailable in CatalogTracker, it seems we could do without them?

Hey Jean-Daniel Cryans, are you planning to do all the above in a single patch. Can we break this up into multiple parts (like the migration code, etc.). Since this patch somewhat blocks HBASE-7213, I was wondering whether we could commit the core functionality (the patch you attached here), and do the rest as follow ups. After the core patch goes in (including the unit test fixes), we could commit 7213.. Thoughts?

Next up is trying to figure out what to do with MetaNodeTracker and metaAvailable in CatalogTracker, it seems we could do without them?

Looking at the patch, I see that you have commented out lots of code, including stuff to do with metaAvailable. In that sense, seems we could do without them..
Yeah I was planning a single patch but we can do the steps in multiple jiras. I think stack has the same opinion.
Posting a much needed rebase because of HBASE-7213 and a bunch of others. I just ran TestHBaseFsck and it worked.
Found that TestAdmin has a new "testRootTableSplit" test and it fails. Leading me to do a lot more cleanup around that part of the code.

New patch that's rebased on the latest (had one conflict in hbck) and fixes almost 10 tests, most of them we relying on having 2 regions minimum... now it's only 1!

Still running tests on my end to see if I missed anything.

Thanks for your patience.


-    if (encodedRegionName.equals("70236052")) {

+    /*if (encodedRegionName.equals("70236052")) {

       return encodedRegionName + "/-ROOT-";

-    } else if (encodedRegionName.equals("1028785192")) {

+    } else*/ if (encodedRegionName.equals("1028785192")) {

Why not remove the first if block ?


   public boolean isMetaTable() {

-    return isRootRegion() || isMetaRegion();

+    return isMetaRegion();

It would be better if the above method can be removed. It was created to accommodate both -ROOT- and .META. tables.

For MetaRegionTracker:


+  static byte [] toByteArray(final ServerName sn) {

Should the above method belong to ServerName class ?

Minor stuff to remove:

  • Can remove the constants for ROOT from HConstants.
  • Root's HRegionInfo can be removed.
  • Root's HTableDescriptor can be removed.
  • MetaMigrationConvertingToPB still has a bunch of Root related stuff.
  • The region list template still explains what root is for.

Getting into the code now. Looks good.

Thanks for looking at the patch guys, much appreciated.

Why not remove the first if block ?

I'm still on the fence about removing some of the core code. We may need to keep it around for migration/upgrade, which I haven't tackled yet.

It would be better if the above method can be removed. It was created to accommodate both ROOT and .META. tables.

Comment above + I'd like to verify the semantics of meta tables. It's probably fine to remove, but not there yet.

Should the above method belong to ServerName class ?

I'll look at it, as you can see this new class just has the code from RootRegionTracker.

Can remove the constants for ROOT from HConstants.
etc

See my first answer to Ted.

The region list template still explains what root is for.

Ah I missed it in my rebase I think, thanks!

May be it's totally stupid question, but would it make sense to use this migration to rename '.META.' as well , to make it compatible with the Windows file naming policy, mentioned by Enis Soztutar in another Jira?
Nicolas Liochon I'd rather have it in subsequent Jira.

May be it's totally stupid question, but would it make sense to use this migration to rename '.META.' as well

I though I would never see this day. The jira for windows is HBASE-6818, but it does not rename the table, but only the table dir name. I'll open another one for discussing the rename.

New patch rebased on the latest trunk including all the files that moved. Fixed a few more medium tests.

TestMetaMigrationConvertingToPB is broken and commented out since the actual migration process is broken by this patch.
